alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 5:39PM MDT until August 24 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following counties, Rio Arriba and Santa Fe. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Espanola, Pojoaque, Pojoaque Pueblo, Sombrillo, Nambe Lake, Santa Cruz, Cuartelez, La Puebla, Santa Clara Pueblo, Nambe Pueblo, Jaconita, Jacona, El Rancho and Cuyamungue. - This includes the following low water crossings... County Road 113, County Road 113, County Road 84, East Feather Catcher, Feather Road, La Puebla Road and Old Callejon Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
